channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: Seven Virginia school districts filed a lawsuit over Gov. Glenn Youngkin’s executive order to make masks optional in public schools. https://t.co/1hLw4ZiX78

Elio’s, a restaurant in Manhattan, said it was investigating after Sarah Palin, who's not vaccinated against the coronavirus, dined indoors there on Saturday despite a city vaccine mandate. She tested positive for the virus on Monday. https://t.co/cuzmsUiKLX
Breaking News: Cash payments for low-income mothers increased brain function in babies, a study found, with potential implications for U.S. safety net policy. https://t.co/CPi24odr48
Breaking News: The Webb telescope reached its final stop a million miles from Earth, and will now prepare to study light from the beginning of time. https://t.co/YK3oTLhiKL https://t.co/Kv4MmTf6a2

Surgery to remove cataracts, which cause the eye’s normally clear lens to become cloudy, can restore vision almost instantaneously. But new research suggests it may have another benefit: a reduced risk for Alzheimer’s disease and other forms of dementia. https://t.co/bJDTmyfG5F

Sarah Palin has tested positive for the coronavirus, forcing the delay of her defamation trial against The New York Times, which was set to begin with jury selection on Monday morning. Palin is not vaccinated, the judge in the case said. https://t.co/K1pGU14Oo5

Thierry Mugler, the genre-busting French designer who dominated European runways in the late 1980s and early ’90s, died on Sunday at 73. He was one of the main architects of an aesthetic that married S&M and high fashion. https://t.co/jvaeCdLCQ8 https://t.co/AlN4dnm2lm

Ukraine has a plan to defend an invasion of Chernobyl, one of the most radioactive places on earth. “We don’t know what will kill us first, the virus, radiation or war,” said a resident with a shrug. https://t.co/JbSBn8dja6

Timothy Heaphy, the top staff investigator on the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, has been fired by the state’s new Republican attorney general from his position as the top lawyer for the University of Virginia. https://t.co/2zXJ312BSr
For an exhausted group of mothers in Boston, the pandemic had been so draining that they just wanted to scream. So they did. https://t.co/6oaO3EGjKG https://t.co/Z5DIoULSJg

In Opinion
"This time, Mr. Putin’s aim is bigger than closing NATO’s 'open door' to Ukraine and taking more territory — he wants to evict the United States from Europe," writes Fiona Hill, who served as national intelligence officer for Russia and Eurasia.https://t.co/14zNmqhZjs

President Biden is considering deploying several thousand U.S. troops, as well as warships and aircraft, to NATO allies in the Baltics and Eastern Europe amid fears of a Russian incursion into Ukraine. https://t.co/uQrFEaz9zX
Thierry Mugler, the genre-busting French designer who dominated European runways in the late 1980s and early 1990s, died. He was 73. https://t.co/jE2iJXHjLi

As more vaccinated people are infected with Omicron, they may build “hybrid” immunity, which is what scientists call the combined protection of pre-existing vaccine antibodies and natural antibodies from a breakthrough infection.https://t.co/9YZNYqHzwO
Here’s how to use those bananas browning on your countertop. https://t.co/J6oEUxxyCq https://t.co/oTP9TWYXj0
Illinois homeowners can now remove from their property deeds racist language that was used to bar people of certain races and religious groups from buying property. https://t.co/KY1rBnnStp

John Stockton, one of the most celebrated basketball players in history, is barred from attending games at his alma mater, Gonzaga University, because he refused to comply with the school’s mask mandate. His season tickets were revoked. https://t.co/ccncP1GfWI

Frontline medical workers in the U.S. are angry — at the patients who refuse to get vaccinated and at the political leaders who call them “health care heroes” while opposing mask and vaccine mandates. https://t.co/loxGg0BUxY
This popular Peruvian condiment requires only five ingredients, but it’s bursting with flavor. https://t.co/LjqAeecILS https://t.co/76k3UuJqtU

A passenger from Galway, Ireland, refused to wear a mask on a flight from Dublin to New York, pulled down his pants and exposed his buttocks, threw a can at a passenger and put his cap on the captain’s head, prosecutors said. https://t.co/AgEjsYwDRI

Something infectious is spreading through the work force. Its symptoms present in a spate of two-week notices. Its transmission is visible in real time. And few bosses seem to know how to inoculate their staff against this quitagion. https://t.co/VE4GLDVUe0

The Social Security Administration now allows gay men and lesbians to receive survivor’s benefits if they can show that they were in a committed relationship and would have married had that been possible. https://t.co/5xqTkoAeDc

New Zealand announced on Sunday that it would impose its highest level of Covid restrictions across the country at midnight and Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said that her wedding would not be held in the coming weeks as planned. https://t.co/AAHa1Gidmu https://t.co/92Xfn49L4g
After last night's defeat by the 49ers, Aaron Rodgers must contemplate his future with the Green Bay Packers much sooner than he had hoped. https://t.co/znz0CPTXkc

A Jewish couple living in Tennessee planned to adopt in Florida. But the agency that had been scheduled to provide a family-training course required in their state backed out, saying the couple did not share its Christian beliefs, a lawsuit says. https://t.co/oKrLUttvwK
The Pennsylvania State Police said that a pickup truck with an enclosed trailer full of 100 monkeys had collided with a dump truck and that four of the monkeys had escaped. https://t.co/KKaWKaW1V0
Applications now open: https://t.co/Nm7YAoZKxE
This may become your new favorite chocolate chip cookie recipe, if it isn’t already. https://t.co/LI7VKmp8qd
The San Francisco 49ers upset the Green Bay Packers to advance to next Sunday's conference championship game. https://t.co/fHExZUpAqe

“Many of us have been running all our lives. Practice stopping”: Here is a modest selection of thoughts from Thich Nhat Hanh, the influential Zen master who died at 95 on Saturday. https://t.co/IbQ3FjQN39
Breaking News: Britain said that Russia had begun developing plans to install a pro-Kremlin leader in Kyiv, as Russian troops threaten Ukraine’s borders. https://t.co/IcEsjUa1Xu

A rift between Senator Kyrsten Sinema and fellow Democrats in Arizona deepened on Saturday as the state party formally rebuked her for refusing to change the Senate’s filibuster rules to pass sweeping voting rights legislation. https://t.co/e2SpkItvXN

Pete Davidson (who still lives on Staten Island) and Colin Jost (who no longer lives on Staten Island) are among a group of investors who just bought a hulking Staten Island Ferry boat. The group hopes to turn it into an arts and entertainment venue. https://t.co/noskvuweq7

Omicron now accounts for more than 99.5 percent of new infections in the United States, according to estimates from the CDC. Scientists have been working overtime to study this variant. Here's what they've learned so far. https://t.co/Bo8mmpJ5Z9

Lisala Folau, 57, survived 26 hours floating in the sea after an underwater volcanic eruption sent a tsunami crashing through his home.
“It’s one of these miracles that happens,” said New Zealand’s acting high commissioner in Tonga. https://t.co/AAO7KUD9uI

Lisala Folau, 57, survived 26 hours floating in the sea after an underwater volcanic eruption sent a tsunami crashing through his home.
“It’s one of these miracles that happens,” said New Zealand’s acting high commissioner in Tonga. https://t.co/0s8sxR9FAR

Munzir El Nezzel lost his leg in a bomb attack in Syria. His son, Mustafa, was born without limbs after his mother was exposed to nerve gas. A viral photo of the two won an international award, helping bring the family to Italy for better lives. https://t.co/hdzuEa5vEA

Booster shots of the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines are not just reducing the number of infections with the highly contagious Omicron variant, they’re also keeping infected Americans out of hospitals, according to data published on Friday by the CDC. https://t.co/JN6rAjkyS6

Two New York City police officers were killed in a shooting in Harlem on Friday, officials said. They were the third and fourth officers to be shot in the line of duty this week, according to the Police Department. https://t.co/kD4Dsd2zjk

A federal judge handed a crucial free-speech victory to six University of Florida professors Friday, ordering the university to stop enforcing a policy that had barred them from giving expert testimony in lawsuits against the state. https://t.co/iHMIuEGMx4

"She should not have been put in this situation." Video of a TV reporter in West Virginia being hit by a car during a live shot has been met with outrage by broadcast journalists who said it underscored the risks of sending reporters out on their own. https://t.co/bVn7P9vxi8
A Syrian dam was on a U.S. "no-strike" list. Some warned an attack could kill thousands. In 2017, a secret American force bombed it anyway. https://t.co/XOagYjtR2P

This one-pot Peruvian chicken and rice dish includes a bright green cilantro purée and is commonly served with salsa criolla, a tangy and spicy red onion relish. But a Louisiana-style hot sauce is a good alternative. https://t.co/RGQ9Fmcrrr

Munzir El Nezzel lost his leg in a bomb attack in Syria. His son, Mustafa, was born without limbs after his mother was exposed to nerve gas. A viral photo of the two won an international award, helping bring the family to Italy for better lives. https://t.co/BV9vq0rPbC
Breaking News: Thich Nhat Hanh, a Vietnamese Buddhist monk who was one of the world’s most influential Zen masters, has died at 95. https://t.co/flgq2gItxL
Intel selected Ohio for its new $20 billion chip manufacturing complex, ramping up efforts to boost U.S. production and alleviate shortages. https://t.co/G8z1cixRWq

Meat Loaf, who was born Marvin Lee Aday, had a career that few could match. He was a trained Broadway belter and a multiplatinum-selling megastar whose biggest hits, like “Bat Out of Hell” and “Paradise by the Dashboard Light,” were radio staples. https://t.co/ZrfOjqBFr7

Louie Anderson, the stand-up comedian, actor and television host known for the comedy series “Baskets,” for which he won an Emmy in 2016, died on Friday. He was 68. https://t.co/WlL0FU3n38 https://t.co/bgH3xFCHWp
Breaking News: Pfizer and Moderna booster shots were extremely effective in preventing those infected with Omicron from being hospitalized, new CDC data shows. https://t.co/unq1FE0oiL

The U.N. approved an Israeli measure to condemn Holocaust denial, a resolution aimed at fighting the rise of misinformation about the murder of nearly six million Jews and millions of others by the Nazis. https://t.co/mld66Anff2
